#Text=Interview with Stephanie Beaumier , City Council candidate for Wards 1 & 5 in Brampton , Canada
#Text=Tuesday , October 24 , 2006
#Text=The upcoming 2006 Brampton municipal election , to be held November 13 , features an array of candidates looking to represent their wards in city council or the council of the Peel Region .
#Text=Wikinews contributor Nick Moreau contacted many of the candidates , including Stephanie Beaumier , asking them to answer common questions sent in an email .
#Text=This ward 's incumbent is Grant Gibson , also challenging Gibson is Malcolm Jones , Larry Lee , Jeffrey Schrik , Jagtar Shergill , and Whoston Wray .
#Text=Interview
#Text=List the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=The residents of Wards 1 and 5 have told me that traffic congestion , public safety and taxes are the most important to them .
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=All of the above-mentioned are very important to myself and the residents in these wards .
#Text=The revitalization of the downtown core is also a key issue that will directly affect the residents of Wards 1 and 5 .
#Text=We must carefully plan to simultaneously improve downtown Brampton while proactively controlling traffic congestion , pollution , and public safety .
#Text=What qualities or experiences do you possess , that make you more desirable than the incumbent ?
#Text=For me , it 's all about people .
#Text=I have a proven track record of working for and with people .
#Text=I have worked for Goodwill Industries , The Credit Valley Hospital Foundation , The United Way and Big Brothers Big Sisters of Peel .
#Text=Working on behalf on the less fortunate has instilled in me a willingness to fight for what is right .
#Text=I will be accessible and responsive .
#Text=I will approach this position with integrity and with passion
#Text=Why do you want to represent your ward on council ?
#Text=Representing the residents of Wards 1 and 5 is a natural progression in my career .
#Text=I feel that my experiences working with people can be brought together to make a stronger difference in this community on a larger scale .
#Text=I moved to Ward 1 in 1975 and have been living in Ward 5 for over 13 years .
#Text=I have personally witnessed the growth of Brampton and the challenges that come with it .
#Text=I will represent a City Council that is based on person-to-person communications .
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=For over two years , I have worked with a team that has raised over $ 1 Million for children , youth and their families in Brampton .
#Text=I have initiated partnerships with service clubs and The City of Brampton for this cause .
#Text=This has been my full time occupation .
#Text=I currently volunteer with The Brampton Canadettes Girls Hockey League and organize community events to benefit various charities .
#Text=Much of Brampton 's existing council is quite seasoned in the civic political process .
#Text=What could you bring to the table as a " rookie " , above and beyond the current roster of councilors ?
